messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] blue gatorade and truth
messages.msgSnippet: All I can say about Gatorade is what I know from experience. We have had every imaginable color in this house of it. My Sierra loves to try them all and see
messages.messageBody:
All I can say about Gatorade is what I know from experience. We have had
every imaginable color in this house of it. My Sierra loves to try them all
and see which ones she likes better. I drink it and prefer the blue and
light green (not the lime one) and also the fierce purple. Alyssa, my
two-year old likes it too. Needless to say, anything she drinks or eats
eventually gets spilled!! I have had it on her skin and clothes. Blue,
fierce grape and fierce berry. I've never had it stain her skin or clothes
to where I couldn't get it out. Meaning couldn't get it out of her clothes,
it stained when it happened but washed out.

Mary B

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] blue gatorade and truth
messages.msgSnippet: Well, we had some purple gatorade once. Didn t stain clothes or skin, but it did stain my floor. Weird. I had to clorox twice to get it up. Myranda Okay, now
messages.messageBody:
Well, we had some purple gatorade once. Didn't stain clothes or skin, but it did stain my floor. Weird. I had to clorox twice to get it up.
Myranda
Okay, now I'm very interested.

Someone who HAS had blue gatorade around says it hasn't stained.

Someone who wanted to disparage blue gatorade said

-=-it won't even come off their SKIN if they spill it.-=-


I think truth is very, very important.
If blue gatorade doesn't stain skin, but a mom has told children it will
(based on what?) and told a large public group of unschoolers it will, why?

I might have to buy a bottle and see what it will stain.

My husband drinks the yellowish gatorade sometimes. He's used powdered
gatorade for big camping trips (SCA tournaments/wars) sometimes. It doesn't
seem to be thick or strong enough to stain anything.

science time

Sandra
